Complete the following Lean 4 code:
```lean4
import Mathlib

open Nat Set

/--
Let $p(z)$ be a polynomial of degree $n$ all of whose zeros have absolute value $1$ in the complex plane. Put $g(z)=p(z)/z^{n/2}$. Show that all zeros of $g'(z)=0$ have absolute value $1$.
-/
theorem putnam_2005_a3
    (p : Polynomial ℂ)
    (n : ℕ)
    (hn : 0 < n)
    (g : ℂ → ℂ)
    (pdeg : p.degree = n)
    (pzeros : ∀ z : ℂ, p.eval z = 0 → ‖z‖ = 1)
    (hg : ∀ z : ℂ, g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2))
    (z : ℂ)
    (hz : z ≠ 0 ∧ deriv g z = 0) :
    ‖z‖ = 1 :=
  sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_2005_a3
    (p : Polynomial ℂ)
    (n : ℕ)
    (hn : 0 < n)
    (g : ℂ → ℂ)
    (pdeg : p.degree = n)
    (pzeros : ∀ z : ℂ, p.eval z = 0 → ‖z‖ = 1)
    (hg : ∀ z : ℂ, g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2))
    (z : ℂ)
    (hz : z ≠ 0 ∧ deriv g z = 0) :
    ‖z‖ = 1 := by
  have h₁ : z ≠ 0 := hz.1
  have h₂ : deriv g z = 0 := hz.2
  have h₃ : ‖z‖ = 1 := by
    have h₄ : ‖z‖ ≠ 0 := by simp [h₁]
    have h₅ : g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2) := by rw [hg]
    have h₆ : deriv g z = 0 := h₂
    have h₇ : deriv g z = deriv (fun z => (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2)) z := by rw [hg]
    rw [h₇] at h₆
    have h₈ : deriv (fun z => (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2)) z = 0 := h₆
    have h₉ : ‖z‖ = 1 := by
      -- Use the fact that the zeros of p(z) all have absolute value 1 to show that z must also have absolute value 1.
      simp_all [Complex.abs, Complex.normSq, Complex.ext_iff, pow_two, mul_comm]
      <;>
        field_simp [h₁, pow_ne_zero] at *
      <;>
        simp_all [Complex.abs, Complex.normSq, Complex.ext_iff, pow_two, mul_comm]
      <;>
        nlinarith [pzeros z (by simp_all [Polynomial.eval_zero]), pzeros (-z) (by simp_all [Polynomial.eval_zero])]
    exact h₉
  exact h₃
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_2005_a3
    (p : Polynomial ℂ)
    (n : ℕ)
    (hn : 0 < n)
    (g : ℂ → ℂ)
    (pdeg : p.degree = n)
    (pzeros : ∀ z : ℂ, p.eval z = 0 → ‖z‖ = 1)
    (hg : ∀ z : ℂ, g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2))
    (z : ℂ)
    (hz : z ≠ 0 ∧ deriv g z = 0) :
    ‖z‖ = 1 := by
  have h₁ : z ≠ 0 := hz.1
  have h₂ : deriv g z = 0 := hz.2
  have h₃ : ‖z‖ = 1 := by
    have h₄ : ‖z‖ = 1 := by
      have h₅ : ∀ z : ℂ, p.eval z = 0 → ‖z‖ = 1 := pzeros
      have h₆ : g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2) := hg z
      have h₇ : deriv g z = 0 := h₂
      -- Use the fact that the derivative of g(z) is zero and the properties of the polynomial zeros
      simp_all [h₆, h₅, h₁]
      <;>
      norm_cast
      <;>
      simp_all [h₅, h₁, Complex.norm_eq_abs]
      <;>
      aesop
    exact h₄
  exact h₃
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_2005_a3
    (p : Polynomial ℂ)
    (n : ℕ)
    (hn : 0 < n)
    (g : ℂ → ℂ)
    (pdeg : p.degree = n)
    (pzeros : ∀ z : ℂ, p.eval z = 0 → ‖z‖ = 1)
    (hg : ∀ z : ℂ, g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2))
    (z : ℂ)
    (hz : z ≠ 0 ∧ deriv g z = 0) :
    ‖z‖ = 1 := by
  have h₁ : ‖z‖ = 1 := by
    have h₂ := pzeros 0
    have h₃ := pzeros 1
    have h₄ := pzeros (-1)
    have h₅ := pzeros (1 / 2)
    have h₆ := pzeros (-1 / 2)
    simp_all [pdeg, hg, Complex.abs, Complex.normSq, Complex.ext_iff,
      Polynomial.eval_zero, Polynomial.eval_C, Polynomial.eval_X,
      Polynomial.eval_mul, Polynomial.eval_add, Polynomial.eval_sub,
      Polynomial.eval_pow, Polynomial.eval_neg, Polynomial.eval_smul]
    <;> norm_num
    <;> aesop
  exact h₁
```

    (pzeros : ∀ z : ℂ, p.eval z = 0 → ‖z‖ = 1)
    (hg : ∀ z : ℂ, g z = (p.eval z) / z ^ ((n : ℂ) / 2))
    (z : ℂ)
    (hz : z ≠ 0 ∧ deriv g z = 0) :
    ‖z‖ = 1 := by
  have h₁ : ‖z‖ = 1 := by
    have h₂ := pzeros 0
    have h₃ := pzeros 1
    have h₄ := pzeros (-1)
    have h₅ := pzeros (1 / 2)
    have h₆ := pzeros (-1 / 2)
    simp_all [pdeg, hg, Nat.cast_eq_zero, Nat.cast_add, Nat.cast_one, Nat.cast_mul, Nat.cast_sub]
    <;> norm_num
    <;> simp_all [Complex.abs, Complex.normSq, Complex.ext_iff, pow_two]
    <;> ring_nf at *
    <;> norm_num at *
    <;> nlinarith [sq_nonneg (‖z‖), sq_nonneg (1 - ‖z‖), sq_nonneg (1 + ‖z‖)]
  exact h₁
```
